author: nicolas.alhaddad
content:
What k * G means is G + G + G .... K times. For k = 2 you are adding G go itself, the + symbol means: you draw a line L tangent to the elliptic curve E at G. L will intersect E at a point you reflect it across the x axis (you multiply by -1 the y coordinate) and this point P would be your result. If k = 3 you take P and you add it to G. Those two points intersect E at a particular point....

When k is big, and even if an attacker knows G and kG he can't compute k in polynomial time. However a person knowing k can compute kG. (This is the trapdoor)

author: nicolas.alhaddad
content: The method is called repeated squaring (if you want to google it). You can compute K*G in log(k). If you know K and G. You keep adding the result you get from the previous stages... (This is just the discrete log problem but in an elliptic curve group)
